c74object.name: the.jit.mojo
c74object.digest: Control a jit.mo.func object in non-realtime
c74object.description:
Written by Tim Heinze Â© 2020, www.xenorama.com.
Objects from the jit.mo family operate in predictable and expected manner when a jit.world is currently enabled. the.jit.mojo can be attached to a jit.mo.func to progress through its phase during offline rendering. Any speed automation must be applied to the jit.mojo instead while the jit.mo.func will be automatically set to a speed of 0.

objarg.name: render-context
objarg.digest: Specify a named render context to bind to.
objarg.description: For convenience, this can be identical to one's world render context name but is to be considered independent. the.jit.thalamus with a unique context name is required running in parallel for all members of the offline render family to sync and respond to.

attribute.name: speed
attribute.digest: Control the speed of an attached jit.mo.func.
attribute.description:
Any speed automation must be applied to the jit.mojo. instead while the jit.mo.func must be set to a speed of 0 at all times to avoid inevitable timing conflicts.
The speed is set in Hz, analogous to the same jit.mo.func attribute.

attribute.name: active
attribute.description:
Set the active flag. There are 4 active states available suitable for different purposes:
0 = ignore this object and pass everything through without recording or recalling
1 = operate normally (default); playback, record and output during rendering
2 = playback and output previously recorded data normally but do not record any new data
3 = playback and record normally but do not output data during rendering
4 = record and output during rendering but never pass incoming data
5 = mute all activity
Note that while recording is disabled, the automatic export upon recording completion (if an exportname is specified) is also disabled and previous files will not be overwritten.
